= Components =
(generated)


*Component items*:
  * *Inner Hair Cells (ear-inner-hair-cells)*: frequency-aligned tonotopic mapping
  * *Outer Hair Cells Feedback (ear-outer-hair-cells-feedback)*: verifies amplify actions done
  * *Cristae and Maculae (ear-cristae-maculae)*: activate afferent receptors in response to rotational and linear acceleration
  * *Somatic Receptors (ear-somatic)*: from skin to geniculate ganglion to spinal trigeminal nucleus
  * *Acoustic meatus skin (ear-acoustic-meatus-skin)*: from skin lining external acoustic meatus, and tympanic membrane to trigeminal gangion
  * *Visceral Receptors (ear-visceral)*: pain, temperature, and touch
  * *Timpanic cavity (ear-timpanic-cavity)*: pain, temperature, and touch
  * *Outer Hair Cells (ear-outer-hair-cells)*: mechanically amplify low-level sound that enters cochlea
  * *Stapedius (ear-stapedius)*: dampens vibrations of stapes
  * *Tympanic Membrane (ear-tensor-tympani)*: dampen sounds, such as those produced from chewing
  * *Auricularis Muscle (ear-auricularis)*: move scalp and to point auricula in direction of source of sound
  * *Posterior Auricular Muscles (ear-posterior-auricular-muscles)*: adjust the direction of the pinna (outer ear)
